datasets.name: data.csv
datasets.description: Related to automated machines, artificial intelligence, and industrial applications.

columns.name: tool_complexity_level
columns.description: Categorical rating of the tooling complexity on the robot, ranked from 1 to 5, where 5 indicates highly complex mechanisms.

columns.name: continuous_operation_need
columns.description: Indicates if the robot needs to operate continuously, with true requiring continuous operation.

columns.name: processing_speed_GHz
columns.description: The clock speed of the robot's central processing unit in gigahertz

columns.name: number_of_sensors
columns.description: Number of sensors installed on the robot

columns.name: has_dual_core_processor
columns.description: Indicates whether the robot's system uses a dual-core processor

columns.name: operational_uptime_percent
columns.description: The percentage of time the robot is operational in a given period, measures how long the robot works as compared to how long it could have worked, measured as a percentage.

columns.name: continuous_operation_capable
columns.description: Indicates whether the robot is designed to operate without breaks or not

columns.name: power_supply_wattage
columns.description: The amount of power in watts that the robot's system requires to operate

columns.name: processor_speed
columns.description: Clock speed of the robot's CPU in GHz

columns.name: training_complexity
columns.description: Rating of training complexity based on required skills and tasks

columns.name: has_advanced_cooling
columns.description: Indicates whether the robot has advanced cooling mechanisms

columns.name: timed_task_sequence_count
columns.description: Number of tasks a robot is programmed to perform in a specific time order

columns.name: system_update_received
columns.description: Whether the robot has received a system update before the training commenced

columns.name: system_updates
columns.description: Number of system updates the robot has received in the last year

columns.name: primary_operational_focus
columns.description: The primary field of task the robot is designed for, e.g., industrial, service, research

columns.name: robot_id
columns.description: Unique identifier for each robot

columns.name: training_schedule_frequency
columns.description: Number of training sessions per month

columns.name: market_sector
columns.description: The primary market sector where the robot is deployed, e.g., consumer, industrial, research.

columns.name: energy_efficiency
columns.description: Energy efficiency rating of the robot on a scale from 1 to 10, where 10 is the most efficient

columns.name: task_success_rate
columns.description: Percentage of tasks successfully completed by the robot

columns.name: task_designation
columns.description: Indicates if the robot is designed for light-duty tasks, where true means light-duty.

queries.question: Is there a relationship between the number of timed tasks, primary operational focus, and power supply wattage for robots designed for industrial tasks with continuous operation capability?
queries.true_hypothesis: Robots designed for industrial tasks, capable of continuous operation, with more than 5 timed tasks, and with specific feature combinations will have their power supply wattage calculated based on a complex formula involving various attributes such as timed task sequence count, primary operational focus, continuous operation capability, task designation, market sector, and continuous operation need.
queries.true_hypothesis_expr: np.where((df['primary_operational_focus'] == 'industrial') & df['continuous_operation_capable'] & (df['timed_task_sequence_count'] > 5), np.random.randint(15, 50), np.random.randint(5, 15)) ** 3 + 10 * (4 - 2 * df['task_designation'] + df['market_sector'].apply(lambda x: {'consumer': -1, 'industrial': 1, 'research': 2}[x]) - 3 * df['continuous_operation_need']) ** 2
